content.description: There's a key shallow pocket on the face of the boulder. Don't go on the underside of Happy Endings.
content.location: Starts the same as Happy Endings but stays on the face of the boulder instead of going on the underside.

content.description: Sit start with a good left hand sloper jug and a right hand mini jug. Place a right heel and make a hard cross to a good edge. Compress up the good slopers and edges through the overhang. Head straight up the face and top out. The landing is a bit sketchy when climbing the face so bring some spotters.
content.location: This problem is on the largest boulder in the area. Head up a small gully to the southeast corner of the block. You should see an obvious overhang with chalked rails and slopers.Â

content.description: Start by hugging the down facing corner with hands and feet on both sides. Climb up left to top out. The landing is kinda sketchy.
content.location: Just to the right of Happy Endings

content.description: This area hosts a number of good climbs but isn't as popular as Middle East. The rock quality is good and it is quiet/secluded/away from people. It also offers a great view of the ranch and valley.
